intro: Mappia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered mappia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture. Mappia fasciculata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
